alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:20PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Keokuk, southeastern Iowa, northwestern Washington and southwestern Johnson Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 320 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Parnell, or 17 miles south of Marengo, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kinross around 335 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wellman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
